contentList.content: War is the lifeblood of hobgoblins. Its glories are the dreams that inspire them. Its horrors don't feature in their nightmares. Cowardice is more terrible to hobgoblins than dying, for they carry their living acts into the afterlife. A hero in death becomes a hero eternal.

Trained in the art of war from birth, these goblinoids are raised to become Generals of destruction. They view the world as a currency to steal; a land to conquer. In time, all will know the sting of the Strongblade's might.

Koalinth are marine goblinoids, Koalinth believe that they were created from surface hobgoblins by Maglubiyet, who sought to conquer the ocean depths. However, the newly-created koalinth were approached by Panzuriel, the Lord of Krakens, who proved himself the true master of the deep and the koalinth remain his loyal servants to this day.

These Hobgoblins often ally with powerful dragons, supplying the drake with treasure and sometimes a lair in exchange for assistance in battle. Of all the chromatic dragons, blue dragons are the most common hobgoblin allies.

Conscripted and transformed by the Fey, these hobgoblins are ferocious guardians of the natural order. The danger of their role has kept them rare, with their beastial nature marking them as anomolies to the modern world. It is not known if these wardens of the wilds are prisoners to the Fey in their own right, but it is clear that their effeciency as a protector is not to be questioned.
Your clan has trained you well in the art of combat. You are proficient in Light Armor, and can wield Warhammers and Mauls with ease.

Assert your inherant dominance, whack the head of a lowly Goblin. Possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DAZED">Daze</LSTag> your target. They can't take reactions and lose the Dexterity bonus to their <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>.
Invoke the fury of Maglubiyet with a powerful shout that frigthens your enemies.
Summon a group of goblin soldiers at your commmand

Your lungs carry the capacity to breathe on land, and in the water. You are immune to suffocation. You are immune to Difficult Terrain when submerged in bodies of water. Additionally, you are proficient with Tridents.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against a target if one of your allies is within [1] of the target and isn't Incapacitated.

Your peak ability is in the water. When you become wet, +1 to all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, and most <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
When you become wet, +1 to all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>, and most <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>.
Rush forward like a powerful wave, creating an vortex of air and water that blasts foes and possibly inflicts <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLEEDING">Bleeding</LSTag>.
Choose your dragon ancestor or benfactor. The damage type associated with that dragon will influence you ability.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a cone of acid.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a cone of lightning.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a column of fire.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a cone of lightning.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a cone of acid.
Your draconic powersversion allow you to spew forth a cone of fire.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a cone of poison.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a cone of fire.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a cone of ice.
Your draconic powers allow you to spew forth a cone of ice.
Your maw crackles with radiant energy; unleash a wave of light upon your foes.
The cut-off pincer of some poor, unfortunate crustacean adhered to a bone shaft, creating a make-shift trident.
Your massive size compared to your fellow goblins has its benefits. You are one size larger than other creatures, and your carrying capacity is increased.
your melee attacks hit with extra force. You deal an additional 1d8 of your melee weapon's damage type to the target.
Unleash a magic-laced howl; your vocals vibrate with thunderous fury. Blow away those in front of you with concussive force.
The Lord of Depths and Darkness
One of Blood Vendor Araj Obladra's elixirs, distilled from a specific sanguine quality, and with properties aligned to an equally specific race.
One of Blood Vendor Araj Obladra's elixirs, distilled from a specific sanguine quality, and with properties aligned to an equally specific race.
One of Blood Vendor Araj Obladra's elixirs, distilled from a specific sanguine quality, and with properties aligned to an equally specific race.
One of Blood Vendor Araj Obladra's elixirs, distilled from a specific sanguine quality, and with properties aligned to an equally specific race.
This blood is blessed by the Great One and allows the affected entity to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Summon_Maglubiyet">Summon Maglubyit</LSTag>
This blood is blessed with Panzuriel legacy and allows the affected entity to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Drown_Koalinth">Summon Maglubyit</LSTag>
This blood is affected by an Azure benefactor and allows the affected entity to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_WildShape_Sunscorch">Wildshape: Blue Dragon</LSTag>
This blood is riled with Fey magic and allows the affected entity to <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_FeyGiftAura">Fey Gift: Aura</LSTag>
Summon The Conquering God, Maglubyit to fight along side you.
Banish your target to the dungeouns of Grashmog, your fortress on Clangor.
Create a bridge to the Outer Plane bringing the battlefields of Avalas to your location.
Affected entity deals an additional on all hits.
Dive deep and pull affected enties underwater while they suffer the various effects of drowning.
Affected entity is suffering damage while being dragged underwater by a Koalinth
